name: market for thermal spraying, atmospheric plasma spray, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate | thermal spraying, atmospheric plasma spray, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30152/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for 'thermal spraying, atmospheric plasma spray, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of 'thermal spray, atmospheric plasma spray, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate'. Atmospheric Plasma Spray (APS) is a coating process which uses a plasma jet gun to melt and accelerate a feedstock (in this case it is carbon steel). The dataset represent the coating of 1 square metre of substrate (carbon steel) with a coating thickness of 450 micrometre. Atmospheric Plasma Spraying is used to apply ceramic, cermet, and metal coatings in several industry sector. These coatings are designed to provide wear, erosion, cavitation, corrosion, abrasion, and heat protection, or to give functional properties such as thermal insulation or biocompatibility.

This activity starts with the service generation.

This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
